GameModel

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel.Character
      • GameModel.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Character
    Player is a subclass of Character, it is the Character type that is controllable by the user during his time in the Mud Game.
    Author:
    Matthew Latura
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class GameModel.Character

        armor, dexterity, precision, strength

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String pass)
      Default constructor takes a String parameter to set the Player's name and a second String parameter is used to set the Player's password.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
      java.lang.String pass)
        Default constructor takes a String parameter to set the Player's name and a second String parameter is used to set the Player's password. Sets most of Players fields to their default starting values.
        Parameters:
        name - - the new Player's name
        pass - - the new Player's password

    • Method Detail

      • printInventory

        public java.lang.String printInventory()
        Returns a string containing a summary of the Player's inventory and his held items
        Returns:
        a string containing a summary of the Player's inventory and his held items

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()
        Returns the Player's password
        Returns:
        the Player's password

      • equipItem

        public Notification equipItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        This method takes a String as the name of an item. It will check if the player has the item and equip it if it is not already equipped. If the equip slot of the item is already used than it will deequip that item and equip the new one
        Parameters:
        itemName - - the name of the item to attempt to equip
        Returns:
        Notification containing a Note telling the player the result of his equip request

      • hasItem

        public Item hasItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Overrides Character's hasItem method(). This method checks the Players inventory in addition to his equip slots for the Item whos name is passed
        Overrides:
        hasItem in class Character
        Parameters:
        itemName - - the name of the item to check for
        Returns:
        the Item object if found, null if no item was found matching the passed name

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        This method overrides Character's getDescription(). Player descriptions are generated based on what they currently have equipped.
        Overrides:
        getDescription in class Character
        Returns:
        the description of this Player

      • getAttackRange

        public int getAttackRange()
        This method overrides Character's getAttackRange() method. It returns the attack range of the player which is based on the weapon he may have equipped. If no weapons are equipped than attack range defaults to 1
        Specified by:
        getAttackRange in class Character
        Returns:
        attack range based on equipped weapon

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        This method returns the Player's damage which is calculated based on his Strength and currently equipped Weapon
        Specified by:
        getDamage in class Character
        Returns:
        Player's base damage

      • getAttackName

        public java.lang.String getAttackName()
        Players attack name is based on his equipped weapon. fists is returned if the Player does not have a weapon equipped
        Specified by:
        getAttackName in class Character
        Returns:
        attack name of Player based on his equipped weapon

      • dropItem

        public Item dropItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Searches for an item in the player's inventory and equip slots based on a passed item name. Removes the item and returns it if found, returns null if no item is found
        Parameters:
        itemName - - The name of the item to look for
        Returns:
        the Item if removed, null if no item by the name was found

      • gainExperience

        public boolean gainExperience(int experienceGained)
        Gives the Player the passed amount of experience points. Returns whether or not the Player leveled up. Level ups occur every 1000 experience points accrued.
        Parameters:
        experienceGained - - Amount of experience to grant the player
        Returns:
        whether the Player leveled up

      • getExperience

        public int getExperience()
        Returns the amount of experience points the player has
        Returns:
        the amount of experience points the player has

        public int getStatIncreases()

        the amount of stat increases the player has available
